posts.post_content: The greatness of this card isn't that it bombs the field. It's that you can control what dies. It's similar to a "do x damage to all creatures," except you don't have to worry about someone adding 2 or 3 and killing something special. I love it. It's a situational bomb, to be sure, but suits many situations.

Posted By: JenBroness (12/22/2010 6:47:31 PM)

posts.post_content:
@AvatarOfHOE  
  
There's a reason [Nevinyrral's Disk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nevinyrral's Disk) costs $10 a card and Pernicious Deed costs $25 a card. The Disk *can* be better in certain scenarios, yes, but in most decks where you can access the ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol), Pernicious Deed is better. The great thing about the Deed is that you can CHOOSE what you want to destroy. If the thing that's winning you the game has 4cmc, you can use the deed to only hit everything ≤3cmc. And unlike other CMC sweepers like [Powder Keg](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Powder Keg)/[Ratchet Bomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ratchet Bomb), this hits "cmc X *or less*," not "cmc *equal to* X." And of course this, unlike all those others (Disk included), can be activated the turn it hits the field.
posts.html:
@AvatarOfHOE

There's a reason Nevinyrral's Disk costs $10 a card and Pernicious Deed costs $25 a card. The Disk can be better in certain scenarios, yes, but in most decks where you can access the , Pernicious Deed is better. The great thing about the Deed is that you can CHOOSE what you want to destroy. If the thing that's winning you the game has 4cmc, you can use the deed to only hit everything ≤3cmc. And unlike other CMC sweepers like Powder Keg/Ratchet Bomb, this hits "cmc X or less," not "cmc equal to X." And of course this, unlike all those others (Disk included), can be activated the turn it hits the field.
